{bc}usually sweet baked goods made of dough having a high fat content

dt.t: I had a {wi}pastry{/wi} and a cup of tea.

shortdef: a dough that is used to make pies and other baked goods and typically has a high fat content : paste
usually sweet baked goods made of dough having a high fat content

dt: {bc}a thick {d_link|custard|custard} that is made of eggs, sugar, milk, flour or cornstarch, and usually flavoring and that is typically used as a filling for pastries and other baked goods

dt.t: Once you've become comfortable with the technique for making {wi}pastry cream{/wi}, opportunities abound for the versatile baker's staple. You can use it as a filling for cream puffs, éclairs, fruit tarts, and cakes …

{wi}Pastry cream{/wi} is an anomaly among custards. Although overheating a typical custard can lead to curdling, it's vital to bring {wi}pastry cream{/wi} almost to a boil. Doing so sets the eggs and activates the starch, thereby ensuring a proper consistency.

Guests will go wild for these little pies. They're at once delicate and decadent, the airy puffs of crisp meringue giving way to rich, vanilla-flavored {wi}pastry cream{/wi} and a sprightly mix of fresh fruit.

shortdef: a thick custard that is made of eggs, sugar, milk, flour or cornstarch, and usually flavoring and that is typically used as a filling for pastries and other baked goods

dt: {bc}a very light, egg-based dough used to make pastries (such as {d_link|cream puffs|cream puff} and {d_link|éclairs|eclair} )

dt.t: {wi}Choux pastry{/wi} is preferred cooked before freezing and filled after thawing …
I fell for {wi}choux paste{/wi}, aka cream-puff dough, early in my cooking career.

et: partial translation of French {it}pâte à choux,{/it} literally, "pastry in the form of cabbages"; {it}choux,{/it} plural of {it}chou{/it} "cabbage," going back to Middle French, back-formation from {it}chous,{/it} plural of {it}chol,{/it} going back to Old French, going back to Latin {it}caulis{/it} "stalk, stem, cabbage stem, cabbage" {ma}{mat|cole|}{/ma}
shortdef: a very light, egg-based dough used to make pastries (such as cream puffs and éclairs ) —called also pate a choux

dt: {bc}a pastry made of a rich raised dough

shortdef: a pastry made of a rich raised dough

dt: {bc}a rich pastry filled especially with custard or fruit

shortdef: a rich pastry filled especially with custard or fruit

dt: {bc}a pastry dough containing many alternating layers of butter and dough or the light flaky pastry made from it

shortdef: a pastry dough containing many alternating layers of butter and dough or the light flaky pastry made from it —called also puff paste
